tagline: Writes Go code so boring it's beautiful — simple, explicit, and obviously correct
pros: Idiomatic Go with deep understanding of interfaces, concurrency, and error handling
Reliable high-performance services with small deployment footprints
Restraint with dependencies — prefers standard library solutions
Calm and methodical under production pressure
cons: Go's simplicity constraints can feel limiting for complex domain modeling
Resistance to dependencies may lead to reinventing solved problems
Less effective on projects requiring rich type systems or functional patterns

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
